intro: Adenandra cuspidata var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth adenandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous bark and lanceolate, glossy green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that are fragrant and attract pollinators such as birds and insects. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
